thread.section_title: Sports - Taft Midway Driller - Taft, CA
thread.title: Lady Wildcats lose third straight

author: Matt Henry Midway Driller Sports Writer mhenry@taftmidwaydriller.com
title: Lady Wildcats lose third straight
text: Lady Wildcats lose third straight Cesar Chavez wins in five sets Comment Taft Midway Driller - Taft, CA By Matt Henry Posted Oct. 20, 2015 at 8:58 PM By Matt Henrymhenry@taftmidwaydriller.com Posted Oct. 20, 2015 at 8:58 PM It may have been a home match, but it was a long Tuesday night for the Taft varsity volleyball team after they were edged out 25-16, 25-27, 25-20, 17-25, 9-15 by the Cesar Chavez Titans. The start of the match turned out to be a back and forth battle with Taft and the Lady Titans tying each other three times to kick off the first set. Taft attempted to pull away with an 8-1 run but Cesar Chavez countered with a 9-3 run to get within one at 14-13. After the teams had traded points, the Lady Wildcats attempted to take off again with a 9-1 run to close out the first set. Following a pair of ties to begin the second set, Cesar Chavez had a 4-2 edge to take an 8-5 lead. The set remained close until the Lady Titans went on a 5-1 run to lead 16-7. Taft narrowed the gap to four at 17-13 but Cesar Chavez took off again with three unanswered points to up the advantage to 20-13. That is when the Lady Wildcats stormed back. Over the ensuing moments of the match, Taft went on a 9-2 run to even the score at 22. After Cesar Chavez scored two straight points, Taft countered with three and was one point away from winning. However, Cesar Chavez scored the final three points to win the set. Cesar Chavez carried that momentum into the third set by racing out to a 4-2 lead. Taft bounced back to tie the set at five and again at seven. The Lady Titans regained the lead but Taft answered with a 6-1 run to lead 13-9. The Lady Titans cut the deficit to one but Taft was able to hang onto the small lead before Cesar Chavez tied the score at 17. After one more time, Taft went on a 7-2 run to win the third set. The pendulum swung back onto the Lady Titans side to begin the fourth set when they outscored Taft 9-4. Following a Taft point, Cesar Chavez went on a 5-1 run to up the advantage to eight. Taft bounced back to get within four but Cesar Chavez answered with a 5-2 run. The Lady Titans held on to a five to seven point lead the rest of the way to force a fifth set. Cesar Chavez raced out to a 3-0 lead to open the final set before Taft 5-1 run to overtake the lead. That would be the last time the Lady Wildcats held a lead with the Lady Titans going on a 5-0 run. Taft whittled the lead down to one at 9-8 but Cesar Chavez outscored Taft 6-1 to win the set and match. By Matt Henry
